TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XhtmlCalendarAdapter extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides an XHTML adapter class for the . For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control or device developers can inherit the XhtmlCalendarAdapter to create a custom adapter to take advantage of a new kind of target device, or to support a custom version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar?displayProperty=fullName> control.
A custom adapter might override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.OnInit%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.OnLoad%2A> methods to change how the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> is first presented to the user. Or, you might change <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.LoadAdapterState%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.SaveAdapterState%2A> to track different information about the state of the adapter. You might change <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> to modify data structures for a custom calendar, or add custom processing to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.Render%2A> method to take advantage of new capabilities in a specific target device. A new target device might also have special needs that require modification to the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlCalendarAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A> method.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The target <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter.SecondaryUIMode%2A> expressed as a string.
Docs.summary: Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter.SecondaryUIMode%2A> according to the user's actions on any primary or secondary page of the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: Always returns because the method always handles the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar?displayProperty=fullName> displays on one or more pages of a mobile device. When the user takes an action on one of those pages, this event handler processes the user's response and determines if the user is done with the calendar and whether the adapter should call <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter.ExitSecondaryUIMode%2A>, or if the user should be directed to one of the secondary pages of the control.

Docs.summary: Creates event handlers, determines how many months the target device can display, and if the request is not a postback, sets the current date as the calendar's visible date. Docs.summary: Fills the display list with eras if the user has selected a date and the user's current culture supports eras. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method uses <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo> to discover whether the user's current culture supports eras.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object SaveAdapterState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the current state of the adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> containing information about the current state of the adapter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the page adapter during <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.SaveViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The state of the adapter can include the following information, returned inclusively in the following order:
- <xref:System.Object> containing the state of the base class.
- `integer` representing the user's currently selected option.
- <xref:System.DateTime.Ticks%2A> of the currently selected date.
- `integer` representing the number of eras if the current user's culture supports eras.
